Fisk and Marianna were both then called up to have their first dance together as a married couple, while almost every single guest took out their phones to record their dance. As Fisk happily danced with the woman he loved in his arms, they soon noticed that something seemed to be wrong, since everybody in the room began watching a video that had been sent to all the phones at the same time. While Fisk tried to ignore this, he eventually grabbed a phone and realized the video was of Ray Nadeem, confessing his crimes and the crimes of the FBI moments before his death, exposing Fisk to the world.

As confusion mounted, Tammy Hattley informed Fisk that something was wrong and several agents were down. At that moment, Fisk and Marianna looked in horror as Benjamin Poindexter, dressed back in the Daredevil Suit, got on the stage and gave his toast to the couple, having just discovered that Fisk had Julie Barnes killed. Poindexter then threw the microphone directly at Marianna's head, only for it to be blocked by the arrival of Daredevil. Fisk and Marianna were then dragged away to safety, as Daredevil and Poindexter furiously fought each other, both intended to attack Fisk for their own reasons.[48]

Once they made it back into their Penthouse, Fisk expressed his fury at Benjamin Poindexter being able to attack them and ruin their wedding, while Vanessa Marianna commented on the threat that Ray Nadeem posed to them which was why she had ordered his death. Fisk vowed to discredit Nadeem and get revenge on Poindexter, only for Marianna to tell him to hold back his anger so that they could escape, knowing Poindexter still posed a serious threat.

Fisk commented to Marianna that she had not made a mistake with marrying him, which she accepted but still pushed him to escape with her before Poindexter could come after them. Just as Fisk made it upstairs to the bedroom where he planned on escaping through the basement door, he found himself face to face with Daredevil. Seeing his enemy again, Fisk told Marianna to run, as Daredevil commented that everything Fisk had rebuilt was now done with. Filled with rage, both Kingpin and Daredevil roared at one another before Daredevil charged at Kingpin, knocking him straight through a wall.

Fisk soon gained control of the fight as he furiously threw Daredevil through a wall and began beating down on him with all his might until Daredevil was able to get back onto his feet and, with a few well-placed strikes, knocked Fisk down the stairs. However, Fisk became distracted from his fight with Daredevil as he saw that Poindexter had entered the Penthouse and was making his way to Marianna, as he intended to kill her in revenge for Julie Barnes' death. Daredevil, however, was the one to get to Poindexter first, kicking him away and getting Marianna to safety as he and Poindexter began to fight.

Before Poindexter could throw items at Marianna to try and kill her, Fisk had charged towards him and then began furiously beating him against a brick wall, although Poindexter's quick reflexes allowed him to dodge the punches as Fisk accidentally punched the brick wall, causing him considerable pain. While Poindexter landed some strikes against Fisk and hit him with a steel bowl, he had proved no match against Fisk's rage as he threw Poindexter up the stairs, beating him against the walls before launching him back as Poindexter had then smashed straight through the glass and landed on the table below.

While Poindexter was briefly taken out of the fight, Fisk was attacked by Daredevil, only for Fisk's rage to allow him then take Daredevil's punches as he punched him back and, with all his rage built up, lifted Daredevil straight into the air and smashed him straight through the kitchen table before continuing to beat him down. This was soon broken up as Poindexter attempted to kill them both by breaking a chandelier over their heads, only for Daredevil to kick Fisk back and roll away himself before it could land on them, while Poindexter had continued throwing knives at Fisk, hitting his protective jacket.

This clash was once again taken away by Daredevil, who blocked everything that Poindexter threw at him before fighting him one on one, while Fisk wrapped Marianna in his coat and attempted to use the distraction to take her away to safety. However, Poindexter soon managed to subdue Daredevil while throwing him through a window before picking up some shards of broken glass and throwing them at Fisk who, now without his protective jacket, was impaled by the shards, causing him considerable pain. While Fisk ripped the shards out of his skin, Daredevil had continued battling against Poindexter.

Despite Daredevil soon regaining the upper hand over Poindexter as he had beat him down, Poindexter had spotted an opportunity to kill Marianna, as he grabbed a steel bowl and threw it with considerable force at her head, only for Daredevil to leap up at the last moment and block it from hitting Marianna. Fisk, enraged by Poindexter's continued attempts to murder his wife, charged at him and lifted him up off the ground before slamming Poindexter's back straight into a brick wall in the corner at full force. This resulted in Poindexter's spine being crushed, leaving him paralyzed on the floor.

Now with Poindexter out of their fight, Fisk turned his attention back to Daredevil and, despite being wounded by Poindexter's last attack, Fisk continued attempting to beat Daredevil to death. However, it soon became apparent that, no matter how much strength and rage Fisk still had, Daredevil remained the superior fighter and still had more energy than Fisk, as Daredevil managed to land several strong hits against Fisk, beating him down until Fisk then managed to land a head butt that knocked Daredevil back for a brief moment, while Fisk then locked eyes with Marianna who had continued watching.

Distracted by looking at his beloved wife, Fisk lowered his arms and allowed Daredevil to continue beating him, as Fisk was beaten down onto his knees and repeatedly struck in the face, as Fisk's blood had stained Rabbit in a Snowstorm as Fisk was finally beaten down into submission. As Marianna screamed in horror, Daredevil considered snapping Fisk's neck, only to stop himself and roar in rage, while Fisk still told Daredevil that he would continue hunting Karen Page as well as Foggy Nelson and he would expose Daredevil's true identity to the world and demanding that Daredevil kill him once and for all.

Knowing that his death would destroy Daredevil's soul forever, Fisk noted that no prison like Rikers Island would be able to hold him in and continued to demand that Daredevil kill him. Daredevil, however, refused to allow Fisk to destroy who he was, furiously vowing that Fisk would spend the rest of his life in his cage, being kept far away from Marianna and knowing that New York City had rejected him and that Daredevil had beaten him. Daredevil had then lifted up his mask, revealing Matt Murdock underneath, while demanding that Fisk keep his secret and never attempt to assassinate Page or Nelson.

Daredevil had then threatened that if he did not agree, then he would prove that Marianna ordered the death of Ray Nadeem. Looking at Marianna, Fisk confessed that he had failed her and admitted that this had been the happiest day of his life, as she told him that all she ever wanted was him. With that, Fisk agreed to Daredevil's terms in order to keep Marianna safe. Having shaken hands, Fisk watched as Daredevil left before Brett Mahoney and his team arrived to arrest Fisk and Marianna, taking the paralyzed Poindexter into custody as Mahoney acknowledged Poindexter was not the real Daredevil.

Having finally been defeated, Fisk was taken outside in handcuffs by Mahoney, along with several FBI agents who had also been exposed by Nadeem's video, including Tammy Hattley. While Fisk was being moved to Mahoney's police car to be taken back to prison, he asked Mahoney to have one final chance to say goodbye to Marianna, who was being put into a separate police car; however, Mahoney refused as he noted how Fisk had not done the same for all the men who he murdered. As Marianna was taken away from him, Fisk roared out in frustration before being taken into police custody once again.[48]

In 2018, Kingpin survived the Snap.[10][11] Due to the scandal that arose from the FBI being corrupted, Kingpin was acquitted of his crimes and his involvement in the corruption.[49] By 2021, he was freed from prison, and still retained a modicum of his criminal power and influence.[11] With the intention of getting all of his lost power back,[50] Kingpin resumed his alliance with the Tracksuit Mafia, with William Lopez as his second-in-command.[51] Kingpin ran his criminal empire alongside his wife Vanessa Marianna,[52] who changed her surname to Fisk.[53]. He also informed Vanessa that Daredevil was Matt Murdock.[54] During this time, Kingpin returned to wearing his father's cufflinks instead of the ones his wife had picked for him. As a means to expand his reach and generate additional revenue, Kingpin founded Sloan Limited to serve as a front for money laundering[10] as well as Fisk Shipping, a railway cargo shipping company with facilities in multiple states.[11][55] He also built relationships with other leaders of the criminal underworld in New York City,[13] including the Five Families.[53]

Fisk's plans to maintain his empire were interrupted when Ronin started hunting down criminals across the globe,[56] although Kingpin's power and influence kept Ronin from attacking him.[51] Seeking to take advantage of Ronin's crusade, Kingpin had Ronin kill the Tracksuit Mafia leaders by informing Ronin, via an informant, that they were attending a meeting at Fat Man Auto Repair. Kingpin informed Kazi Kazimierczak about his plans, who kept his silence on the inside job despite his loyalty to William. As a result, Ronin massacred multiple Tracksuit Mafia members, including William. With Lopez gone, Fisk took over leadership of the Tracksuit Mafia and began mentoring Maya Lopez.[51] Kingpin was soon approached by Henry Lopez, the brother of William who wanted to leave the business after his brother's death. In response, Kingpin threatened to kill Henry if he tried to walk away and instead appointed him to manage the Fisk Shipping facility in Tamaha, Oklahoma.[19]

In 2021, Fisk was informed that Maya Lopez was being arrested by the New York City Police Department, so he went to the crime scene to release her personally as the officers, having recognized him, chose not to stand in his way. With the help of an interpreter, Fisk told Lopez that her reckless behavior concerned him, adding that he mourned her father as well and that he understood her rage.

Lopez doubted that he understood what she felt, so Fisk told her that his father was killed as well when he was twelve years old, omitting the fact that he had been the one to kill him. Fisk added that the pain he felt at the moment his father died was something he had never felt again since, and asked Lopez to let him help her channel her rage in a constructive way.

Fisk sent Lopez to assist his men in attacking a rival criminal enterprise that was planning to move on his territory, in which they succeeded even despite Daredevil's interference. Fisk commended on Lopez's performance, noting that none of his men could hold their own against the vigilante the same way as she did. Fisk asked her if she found his exercise useful to her and Lopez replied positively to Fisk's satisfaction. He stated that Lopez lacked a purpose and a place to call her own, but now that she was with Fisk, he would make sure she had everything she needed.

Fisk started mentoring Lopez, while falsely assuring her that he had dedicated all of his resources to finding Ronin and bringing him to justice. Lopez made Fisk promise that when he found Ronin, she would be the one to kill him to avenge her father, which Fisk agreed with.[11] Fisk assigned Lopez to multiple missions, and during one of their Sunday evening dinners, Fisk raised a toast for Lopez stating that she had completed her final lesson, telling Lopez that she was ready to put her skills to a practical use. He then dismissed the ASL interpreter while signifying to one of his men to assassinate her in the hallway and get rid of the body. Lopez then became one of Fisk's most trusted subordinates and murdered many people on his behalf.[19] Fisk also gave Lopez her father's position as commander of the Tracksuit Mafia, with Kazi Kazimierczak appointed as her second-in-command.[51]

In December 2024, Kingpin learned that Armand Duquesne III had become aware that Eleanor Bishop was working for him and had threatened to expose them both, leading to Kingpin deciding to have him murdered,[56] so he would not be able to disclose the sensible information.[57] Kingpin ordered Bishop to do it, covering their tracks by altering the data to make Jack Duquesne listed as the CEO of Sloan Limited. When Clint Barton appeared in the city and targeted Kingpin's business, he became concerned that an Avenger had taken an interest in his operations, so he put a bounty on Barton's head and had Bishop hire Yelena Belova to assassinate him.

Kingpin was invited to attend a meeting with Bishop, as Bishop reminded Kingpin of their good relationship and how she had always done as she was told, to which Kingpin noted that this was expected while she still held a debt to him, which Derek Bishop had left behind after his death in the Battle of New York. While Bishop insisted she had paid off this debt, Kingpin noted she had made herself wealthy as well, noting he helped provide this.

As Bishop reminded Kingpin that she had killed Armand, and caused her fianc√© to take the blame, she explained that her daughter had returned to New York City, and was getting too close to learn the truth, which Bishop refused to allow. Kingpin stated that there cannot be lines drawn in his business, to which Bishop told him that she would instead leave the business entirely, as Kingpin demanded her not to be rash.

Ignoring Kingpin's warnings, Bishop explained that she had kept copies of all their dealings as her own insurance policy against him, believing that this would protect her from Kingpin's fury. In the spirit of the holidays, Kingpin gave Bishop a minute to rethink the decision that she was making, but Bishop declared that she did not need a minute, and proceeded to walk out of the meeting, leaving Kingpin enraged.[10]

While Fisk was making plans with Kazi Kazimierczak, they were then joined by Maya Lopez, as Fisk got to his feet and noted that he had seen Lopez at the end of several tough fights, but there was something more going on, with Fisk inviting Lopez to tell him about her fights with Ronin, all while Kazimierczak translated. As Lopez said nothing, Fisk reminded her that he had taught her to keep a low profile.

In response, Lopez apologized to Fisk, admitting that she had gotten carried away, with Kazimierczak continuing to translate for Fisk. When Lopez noted that Fisk knew what her father had meant to her, Fisk then insisted that he meant a lot to all of them, continuing to maintain the lie that he was not involved in his death. Lopez then told Fisk that she had come to her senses, promising that she would focus on the job.

Surprised, Fisk noted that this was quite the change of heart, to which Lopez noted that no matter what she did, she could not bring her father back, and that finding whoever killed him, would not change anything, with Fisk still not reacting to the references to her father's killer. Instead, Fisk had told Lopez that her father would have wanted her to move on, suggesting he wished her father could see the woman she became.

Lopez had then asked Fisk if she could have a couple of days off from her work in order to clear her head, which Fisk had agreed with, noting that it seemed reasonable in the circumstances. Once Lopez went to leave, Fisk stopped her, before telling her in sign language that he loved her, which Lopez said back to him. With that, Lopez left, although Fisk still remained skeptical about her true intentions, as he had considered what to do.

Fisk began to complain to Kazimierczak about Ronin seemingly returning to New York City, while he also had to deal with Hawkeye taking an interest in his operations. As Fisk became increasingly angry about all of these complications which had arisen, he had then raged about Eleanor Bishop quitting her position within his organization, seemingly not taking their operation's work as seriously as they had needed her to do.

Fisk then concluded that Lopez had also seemingly turned against him and their Tracksuit Mafia, which Kazimierczak agreed with, as they both believed that Lopez had most likely uncovered the truth about her father's death. Fisk asked Kazimierczak what he thought they should do about it, wanted to test his loyalty. Fisk stepped up to Kazimierczak and noted that people needed to be reminded that he owned the city.[10]

Remaining enraged by Eleanor Bishop's decision to leave his organisation, Kingpin sent the Tracksuit Mafia to Rockefeller Center to assassinate her, with Kazi Kazimierczak leading all their attacks. However, the Tracksuits were confronted by Hawkeye and Kate Bishop, allowing Eleanor to escape. Despite this, Kingpin caught up to Eleanor's car and furiously killed her driver, before he ripped the car door away.

As Kingpin told Eleanor that he would not allow her to leave, and attempted to pull her out of the car, he was confronted by Kate, who aimed her bow and arrow at Kingpin, demanding he leave her mother alone. Unimpressed, Kingpin questioned what she would do with the weapon, to which Kate then responded by shooting an arrow into Kingpin's chest. However, Kingpin's hidden body armor allowed him to survive the shot, as he snapped the arrow.

Shocked by this, Kate took a grappling arrow at shot at Kingpin again, only for him to grab it in mid air, and then furiously pull Kate towards him, before punching her in the air, knocking her back down onto the ground. As Kingpin removed his jacket and prepared to kill Kate, he was suddenly and unexpectedly struck by Eleanor's car, as she had moved into the driver's seat and driven at him, causing Kingpin to crash through a shop window.

Kingpin soon recovered from the impact and got back onto his feet, ready to kill Eleanor, who was injured from the impact. However, Kate had once again stood between Kingpin and his revenge, as she attempted to punch him, only for Kingpin to grapple with his bow, insisting that Kate was in over her head. Kingpin managed to throw Kate to the ground and moved towards Eleanor, as Kate fired an electrified shield arrow, blocking Kingpin's path.

This enraged Kingpin even more, as Kate attempted to attack him again, only for Kingpin to punch her hard in the stomach, knocking her across the room. Kingpin attacked Kate as she attempted to crawl away, grabbing hold of her Quiver and throwing her across the room, before breaking her arrows in half, telling her to mind her business. Despite these warnings, Kate again attempted to get Kingpin into an armlock, only for him to throw her aside.

In spite of everything, Kate still refused to give up, as she slid under Kingpin's legs and confronted him again, only for Kingpin to push her backwards once more, as Kingpin told her that she was beginning to annoy him. However, as Kingpin had taken a step towards her, walking over all of the broken trick arrows, Kate had then revealed that she had managed to steal one of his cufflinks, which she flicked down at the broken arrows.

Once the cufflink had struck the broken arrow heads, it caused a chain reaction, as multiple arrows exploded at once, causing a massive fireball, fireworks and shockwaves. All of these blasts happened directly under Kingpin's feet, causing him to get thrown backwards and hitting his head against a pillar, knocking him unconscious. Once Kate was sure Kingpin was unconscious and unable to fight, she went to check on her mother.[10]

Eventually, the New York City Police Department arrived at the scene and arrested Eleanor Bishop for her part in all of Kingpin's schemes, but he had managed to get out of the scene before the officers could find him. Still wounded following his battle against Kate Bishop, Kingpin painfully made his way through the streets of New York City, until his path was blocked by a car.

As the car pulled up in front of him, Kingpin realized that the driver was Maya Lopez, as he breathed a sigh of relief, only for Lopez to reveal a gun. Kingpin soon realized that Lopez had indeed learned that Kingpin had been responsible for her father's death at the hands of Ronin. Kingpin then told Lopez that they were family, and that families did not always see eye to eye. Lopez responded by shooting him, causing Kingpin to fall down.[10]

Lopez assumed Kingpin was killed and fled the scene, unaware that he had survived the shot and was put under hospital care. While Kingpin remained in the hospital, his damaged eye was covered with with an eyepatch and a bandage while it healed.[11] During this time, Vanessa Fisk sat by his bedside for months, waiting for him to awaken.[53] Kingpin's survival was also kept a secret, with the underworld believing that he had been killed, and a bounty was placed on Lopez's head.[11]

Five months later, Fisk finally recovered enough and was able to leave the hospital. He was informed that the Black Knife Cartel found Maya Lopez in Tamaha and was about to kill her in retribution for destroying one of their arms shipment in New York. He called Zane and ordered him and his men to stand down, just as he was about to execute both Lopez and her uncle. Fisk then decided to see Lopez personally and took his private jet to Oklahoma, awaiting her return at the Battiest Residence.[58] As Fisk approached her, Lopez immediately tried to distance herself, before Fisk's men surrounded and subdued her.

While she struggled, Fisk came closer and applied Translator Contact Lens to her eyes, which he commissioned so they could converse freely. Shocked that Fisk was not dead, she asked why he was there, to which Fisk replied that he simply wanted to have a Sunday family dinner like they used to. Lopez snarked that it was Tuesday but she entered the house with Fisk regardless. As they went to the dining room, Fisk told Lopez that he was not angry with her, while taking off his eyepatch and showing Lopez the damage from the gunshot. Fisk said that Lopez only did what she thought she had to do, which impressed him, and remarked that there must be a part of her that was happy to see Fisk alive.

Lopez disagreed with that, saying that she wanted him dead, but Fisk argued that the expression of relief on her face said otherwise. He expressed his disappointment that Lopez was so quick to assume the worst and turn against Fisk, as she used to see him as a hero, but she said that was no longer the case. Fisk replied that despite everything, he still cared about her and did not want to see her getting hurt. Fisk presented Lopez with wine he had brought, and she told him that she would open it. Fisk explored the house and looked at the picture of Lopez and her family, and once she returned, Lopez nonchalantly said that she poured the wine down the drain, which did not upset Fisk too much.

As the two sat down with cookies from Lopez's favorite bakery, Fisk accidentally dropped some kitchenware and seeing Lopez alerted at him holding a knife, Fisk simply handed it to Lopez. Fisk insisted that he knew everything about Lopez and they cannot trust anyone but each other. Lopez then inquired why Fisk actually came to her, so he proposed her to come back to New York City with him, adding that he is willing to hand over the control of his criminal empire to her in exchange. Seeing Lopez conflicted, Fisk said that he would be waiting at the Choctaw Casino until tomorrow, asking Lopez to consider his offer, before leaving.[19]

On the next night, while Fisk was at the Choctaw Casino, Maya Lopez arrived and held him at the gunpoint, as Fisk anticipated her trying to kill him again. Fisk took a seat in the chair and told Lopez that he had always loved her like a daughter, but Lopez replied that all her childhood was only a fantasy that made her view him as a hero, instead of a monster. Fisk argued that at every point, Lopez knew what she was a part of and never questioned why she had to kill all those people. Lopez did not budge and claimed that Fisk isolated her from a normal life but never truly cared about her, implying that he gave her Translator Contact Lens only because he never cared enough to learn ASL.

In response, Fisk lashed out at her that he was always there for her but admitted that he had failed Lopez, the same way his own father failed him. Fisk then showed Lopez a hammer that he kept as a memorabilia of what he had to do to become the man he was now. He told Lopez that his father only felt strong when he was abusing his mother, so Fisk had to become stronger and stop him. Lopez was shocked to find out that Fisk killed his own father, to which Fisk responded that he had to do it to become free and move forward with his life. Fisk then handed the hammer over to Lopez, encouraging her to kill him and free herself like he did, while also freeing Fisk himself.

Lopez hesitated for a few moments, before refusing to go along with Fisk's suggestion and put the hammer away. Fisk remarked that both of them have come the full circle now, adding that he expects her to return with him tomorrow. The next morning, Fisk boarded his private jet and waited for Lopez, however, he was informed by his subordinates that Lopez left Tamaha and they were unable to tail her, which greatly enraged him.[19]

Fisk later came to a postal office, where he saw Chula Battiest dropping several envelops, so he helped her pick them up. Battiest noted that Fisk was not a local, asking if he came for the powwow, to which he elusively agreed to. Fisk noted that he did not expect to see so many people in town, to which Battiest replied that guests come all over for the Choctaw powwows. Fisk then took notice of Battiest's necklace, which said "I love you" in ASL, and when Battiest asked if Fisk could sign, he said that he was trying for his niece. Battiest said that she learned ASL for her late daughter and Fisk mentioned that he also lost a person he loved which hurt him quite a lot. Battiest told him that she kept it up for her granddaughter, but when Fisk asked about her, he confirmed that they were both talking about Lopez all along.[13]

Kingpin then ordered his men to capture Chula Battiest and Bonnie, while the Black Knife Cartel infiltrated the Choctaw Nation Powwow and waited until for further orders. Maya Lopez confronted Kingpin with a gun in her hand, but Kingpin revealed that he had Battiest and Bonnie as his hostages, while his men surrounded Lopez.

With Bonnie acting as an interpreter, Kingpin expressed his disappointment in Lopez, who betrayed him after he offered her everything, but Lopez argued that Kingpin was the one who betrayed her. She insisted that Battiest and Bonnie were her true family and they had nothing to do with this, to which Kingpin replied that now he knew how much it would hurt her when he killed them just like he killed Lopez's father.

Kingpin then ordered his men to attack Lopez, however, she was able to summon the powers of her ancestors and pass them over to Battiest and Bonnie. To Kingpin's shock, the three of them were able to fight back against his men. Kingpin then attempted to charge at Lopez himself, but she was able to stop him by touching his heart with her powers. She then tapped into his mind and sent Kingpin into the memories of his childhood, where he found himself at his old house. Kingpin was able to hear his father beating his mother through the cracked wall, which made him succumb to his trauma.

As Kingpin was on the verge of a breakdown, Lopez appeared in front of him and told Kingpin that he must let go of the pain and anger inside of him. She pleaded with him, saying that he was still her uncle no matter what and he must shut out the voice of his father, but Kingpin screamed that he was not the person Lopez wanted him to be. He then reached for the hammer, to which Lopez asked him to hand it over, but Kingpin was unable to let go of the pain completely. As Lopez restored them to reality, a distraught Kingpin grabbed her hands and demanded her to know what she had done to him. The experience proved to be too much for Kingpin, who then abandoned his plans to kill Lopez and her family and ordered his men to retreat.[13]

Fisk boarded his private jet in order to return to New York City and contacted his associates, claiming that the situation must be stabilized before it spiraled out of their control. While talking over the phone, Fisk saw NY1 reporting on the upcoming race for the New York mayor and watched Pat Kiernan and Errol Louis talk about an ideal candidate who would take care of the city's legitimate issues.

As they mentioned that there was still a window of opportunity for a surprise candidate to emerge, Fisk expressed interest in joining the mayoral race.[13] Upon returning home, he spoke with Vanessa and informed her of his mayoral ambitions before he distanced himself from her, leaving Vanessa to continue to run his empire by herself. During this time, Fisk lost weight and gained more muscle, and began wearing darker colored suits once more. Later that year, Fisk learned that Foggy Nelson had been killed by Benjamin Poindexter.[53]

In late 2026, Fisk was notified that he had received the two hundred thousand signatures necessary to officially run for mayor. He enjoyed a small meal before he went to get dressed, and briefly lingered on a white suit before opting for a gray one.

He headed to a warehouse where Vanessa Fisk was conducting a meeting with the Five Families and interrupted it, telling Vanessa that he needed to speak with her. As the other criminals swiftly left, Vanessa chided Wilson for returning after months away and then prematurely ending a Families meeting, while Wilson merely commended her for having kept them in line in his absence while also having garnered their respect.

Wilson stated that he was broken and shattered[53] by Maya Lopez[13] and that he had to put himself back together, but that during his recovery process, his love for Vanessa and his desire to help New York City had been reignited. He notified Vanessa that during his mayoral campaign, his assets could not be perceived as illegal, and Vanessa assured him that she had structured their businesses to elude scrutiny. Wilson then told her that he had the sufficient signatures and that it was time for him to officially declare his mayoral candidacy.[53]

With the sufficient signatures obtained, Fisk got on television and began speaking about the state of vigilantes in New York City and how they needed to be stopped in order to make the city safer. Fisk then declared that he would be able to fix the system and the city publicly announced this candidacy for mayor of New York City, using the slogan "Fisk Can Fix It." Fisk hired Sheila Rivera to serve as his assistant and political advisor, while Buck Cashman served as his assistant and right-hand man. As he watched the polls, Rivera informed him that rivals Roger Cressna and Diana Montoya were ahead of him, and that he needed to refine his message for the upcoming debate, to which Fisk stated that his message was already clear.

As Cashman stated that Fisk's messaging did not need refining, a young man behind Fisk chimed in and agreed with him, and claimed that Fisk was all over social media, including on The BB Report, and that "Fisk Can Fix It" was trending. Fisk asked the man who he was, who responded that his name was Daniel Blake. Fisk asked Blake why he would vote for him, and Blake replied that Fisk had made something for himself and that he believed he would do the same for New York before profanely stating that Mayor Fisk was the coolest thing he had heard. Fisk asked Rivera where she had found Blake, and Rivera informed Fisk that Blake had single-handedly canvasses over two thousand signatures for Fisk and that he was cheap to employ. Fisk then gave Blake a look and then walked out of the room, followed by Cashman and Rivera.

One night, Fisk participated in the mayoral debate against Cressna, where he informed the public that he had been shot by a vigilante and discussed the dangers of vigilantism. When Cressna stated that he agreed with him, Fisk balked that Cressna was posing and that while Cressna proposed registration for vigilantism, Fisk wanted to treat the problem at its root by outlawing vigilantism.

The next day, Fisk exited a NY1 station and greeted his fans when he noticed Matt Murdock outside. Fisk told Cashman it was fine when he tried to keep him from getting near Fisk. He approached Murdock and remarked that it had been quite some time since they last met. Murdock then asked Fisk if they could have a conversation, and Fisk agreed; Fisk then followed Murdock as the pair walked to Square Diner.[53]

Sitting across from each other in a booth, Fisk listened to Matt Murdock comment on his muscle gain as a result of his weight loss, causing Fisk to tell Murdock that he was not intending to fight him. Fisk then remarked that it was not entirely unpleasant to see Murdock and asked about his life. Fisk briefly mentioned his tutelage of Maya Lopez, resulting in her shooting him in the face, which they both laughed off.

As they continued to talk, they both reflected over how they stopped visiting Hell's Kitchen as much and that they had both improved in their careers. Fisk explained his intentions for becoming mayor, but Murdock was doubtful due to Fisk's multiple attempts to kill him, although Fisk accused Murdock of the same. Murdock insisted that he never tried to kill Fisk, who was unconvinced. Fisk took the opportunity to assure Murdock that he had nothing to do with Foggy Nelson's death, as per their promise.

Murdock believed that Fisk was using being the mayor of New York to serve his own goals, but Fisk answered that he genuinely wanted to fix the city. Fisk asked Murdock why he stopped being Daredevil, which was due to him trying to kill Benjamin Poindexter. Fisk spoke about dealing with their violent natures and the power it had over them. When Murdock threatened to bring down Fisk if he reverted to his old ways, he responded that when elected mayor, he would not tolerate vigilantes, threatening Murdock to not return as Daredevil. With the two understanding each other, Murdock got up and left the diner.[53]

Having gained the majority of votes, Wilson won the election and became the new mayor of New York. As his campaign team celebrated around him, Wilson looked over to Vanessa Fisk, and the two silently shared a glance at each other. Upon giving a speech about making New York safer, Wilson was joined by Vanessa on the roof, where he revealed that he knew that she having an affair with a man named Adam. While Sheila Rivera outlined the day's agenda, Fisk asked about the desk he was sitting at, wondering if Fiorello La Guardia sat at the same one. Fisk explained that La Guardia was a hero of his father's, being the only man he respected. Fisk returned to his agenda, expressing his wish to push the meet and greets, but Rivera emphasized the importance of establishing connections within the first few days. While stuck in traffic with Rivera, Buck Cashman, and Daniel Blake, Fisk was advised by them on where his strongest supporters were located throughout New York. Learning that a pothole was causing the traffic, Fisk got out of his car and ordered nearby construction workers to get it filled. A crowd of people gathered, and Fisk reiterated his promise to fix things.[52]

As a favor for Daniel Blake, Fisk agreed to meet with BB Urich. Fisk remarked that Urich's coverage of his campaign was spot on and he admired that she took him seriously. Fisk then learned that Urich was related to Ben Urich, so Fisk told her that he knew her uncle and that he was a good journalist. Fisk listened to Urich talk about how Commissioner Phil Gallo was resigning, which would hurt Fisk, as many other officers were also going to step down in protest.[52]

Fisk arrived at the funeral for Kel Shanahan to speak with Commissioner Phil Gallo about his retirement. Gallo immediately berated Fisk, knowing he has been responsible for the deaths of many other police officers. Fisk attempted to move past the issue, but Gallo explained that he intended to end Fisk's term as mayor. Before walking away, Gallo called Fisk out for not actually loving New York, but was just a monster trying to rewrite his legacy.

Gallo met with Fisk to declare his retirement, but Fisk revealed his blackmail. Fisk worsened the situation by making major cuts to the NYPD, forcing Gallo to not retire. Fisk then spoke to Cashman about blackmail, claiming that anyone could be swayed by a piece of paper before he referred to his cheesesteak as having been disgusting.[52]

Wilson and Vanessa Fisk agreed to seek marriage counseling, so they met with Heather Glenn. Wilson talked about being attacked by Maya Lopez, and how that required him to distance himself while he recovered. When Glenn asked to hear more from Fisk, he simply stated that he did not want to lose Vanessa.[52]

During breakfast, Wilson was informed by Sheila Rivera that there was a double homicide at Red Hook Pier from a hijacking gone wrong. During another session, Wilson and Vanessa spoke privately while Heather Glenn stepped outside, with Vanessa revealing that she sent Buck Cashman to settle the feud between the Five Families. Wilson expressed his concern of not being able to trust Vanessa, but she explained that she wanted to keep the peace. Wilson felt that peace needed to be broken and to let chaos reign so that a stronger order could be built. Vanessa accused Wilson of punishing her for her affair, but Wilson claimed he was not.[59]

When the trial of Hector Ayala ended in a not-guilty verdict, Fisk called on Daniel Blake to schedule another interview with himself and BB Urich. On the record, he disavowed Ayala and the result of the case, declaring vigilantism an affront to the rule of law. He told Urich that he intended to make good on his campaign promise: to bring justice to New York's vigilantes and let the rule of law prevail.[59]

In another session with Heather Glenn, it was suggested they discuss Vanessa Fisk's affair with Adam, although Wilson was uncomfortable with the matter. Wilson stated that it was a betrayal, but Vanessa responded that Wilson leaving her was also a betrayal.

Wilson listened as Vanessa talked about what drew her to Adam, as well as how her father's behavior crushed her mother and that she did not want to feel the same, as Wilson leaving hurt her. Wilson was surprised to learn this, as Vanessa had never told him. Wilson revealed to Glenn that he confronted Adam, claiming that they just talked and he expressed how important Vanessa was to him. Wilson lied about not knowing where Adam was currently. Glenn the concluded the session by telling them that forgiveness was the only way forward. Before leaving, Glenn asked to speak with Vanessa alone, so Wilson left the room.[8]

Fisk brought Sheila Rivera, Daniel Blake, and Buck Cashman to Red Hook Port, where he explained to them his intention to transform it into a new industrial district. Fisk wanted Blake to set up a press conference immediately to make his announcement, but Rivera stopped them, reminding Fisk that there was a process they needed to go through first.

As Rivera explained how city government worked, she brought up the recent mob shooting, which has made people uneasy about the location. Committed to doing things the right way, Fisk asked Rivera on how they needed to start, so Rivera detailed the timeline of steps needed to be completed, which Fisk accepted. Speaking privately with Cashman, Fisk was advised on the situation with the Five Families, being told that it would only end with one of the heads being sentenced or all of them dying.[8]

Fisk was taken to Lincoln Middle School, where he sat in a classroom and painfully listened to children sing "We Built This City," much to his displeasure. When they finished, the teacher went to introduce the next song, but Fisk quickly stopped her, telling them they had to leave. Arriving at the Latvian Cultural Center, Sheila Rivera informed Fisk someone had leaked his recycling project, so he ordered her to summon a meeting. Fisk then went upstairs and listened as the Latvian delegation performed a Latvian version of "We Built This City."

Returning to his office at New York City Hall, Fisk yelled at his staff, assuring them that he would find out which one of them leaked the information. Daniel Blake came forward and confessed to being the leak, so Fisk ordered everyone out of the room. Rivera stayed, and before Fisk could say anything, Blake apologized and expressed his deep respect for Fisk, stating that he would still support him no matter what happened to him. Fisk was taken aback by Blake's loyalty, and in a calmed state, Fisk told him that he would not fire Blake, as loyalty was hard to come by. Fisk then threatened Blake that if he ever leaked information again, it would be the last thing he ever did.[8]

During dinner with Vanessa Fisk, she talked about their session with Heather Glenn, which Wilson was aware that Vanessa was asked if she felt safe in her marriage. Vanessa honestly told Wilson that she told Glenn she did feel safe. Vanessa asked Wilson if she should feel safe, so Wilson told her that he had learned many things from his father, but not forgiveness, which he was trying to do. Wilson expressed his desire for things to go back to how they were between them.

Later that night, Fisk made his way down to his basement where he was keeping Adam prisoner in a cage. As Fisk walked through the basement, he passed the Rabbit in a Snowstorm painting, and sat down at a table, where a full meal was prepared for him. As Fisk poured himself a glass of wine, Adam desperately begged Fisk to let him go, but Fisk ignored him. Fisk recalled Glenn's words about forgiveness being the highest form of love to taunt Adam, who continued to demand his freedom.[8]

As Sheila Rivera ran through the day's agenda, Fisk expressed his exhaustion with attending so many black tie events. In his office, Fisk found Luca waiting for him, so he gave him five minutes to state his business before leaving. Fisk told Luca that he needed to pay Viktor what he owed, but Luca disrespectfully refused. Fisk doubled the amount, but Luca remained unfazed, telling Fisk to stay out of the crime world before leaving.[60]

Fisk later met with Johnny Santini from sanitation, who informed Fisk about the recent murals appearing around the city were made of blood. Fisk summoned Phil Gallo to his office, who explained that the blood was mixed into paint with an epoxy applied on top to make the murals impervious. Gallo revealed that from the blood was from at least sixty victims, and Fisk ordered him not to alert anyone of Muse, at risk of him going into hiding. Fisk then suggested a change of protocol with the NYPD.[60]

The night, Wilson got dressed for the meeting with New York's elite and was joined by Vanessa Fisk, who he informed about Luca's visit. Wilson then explained how politics has its similarities to the crime world, as it was about finding what someone wanted, and either providing it or withholding it to get them to do anything. However, Vanessa explained that it was different tonight, as Wilson had to ask the elite for money, so she educated him on how to deal with them. As Vanessa helped Wilson with his suit jacket, it ripped, as he had put on some weight.

Fisk met with the elite, and he navigated the room, talking with many people about his new project for Red Hook Port. Fisk met with Artemis Sledge and her husband, who were opposed to the idea. Sledge made it clear that she was aware Fisk made a lot of his fortune from business at Red Hook Port, and that the new project was just a self-serving con to enrich himself. Fisk claimed that he only cared about the city, but Sledge stated that despite his supposed power right now, the elite had the control.

Fisk then spoke with Jack Duquesne, who disagreed with Fisk's stance against vigilantes. Duquesne then told Fisk that his project did not align with the elite's interests. Fisk retorted that the elite knew nothing about making things happen, so Duquesne told him not to underestimate the elite, as they could take away his mayorship. Fisk asked if that was a threat, but Duquesne replied that it was a warning. Fisk regrouped with his wife, telling her that the elite were parasites for rejecting his project.[60]

Fisk was interrupted by Buck Cashman and Daniel Blake, who showed him the recent mural by Muse. Cashman claimed that Muse was mocking the NYPD, which Fisk felt they could use to his benefit. Fisk met with Phil Gallo the next day to reveal his plan to assemble a task force led by him to deal with the Muse case.

Gallo noticed Fisk had selected all of the corrupt cops, and Fisk explained that they would receive privileges like overtime and no body cameras. Fisk and Cashman went to meet with the selected cops, who were gathered at a warehouse. Fisk told them that Muse needed to be stopped, and that they were the ones to do it, claiming they had shown "initiative" in the past, and praised their "creative thinking." Fisk then revealed that they were all founding members of his Anti-Vigilante Task Force and told them to show their faces as they take the city back.[60]

With everything building up inside of him, Fisk went to visit Adam, bringing an axe with him. Fisk walked up to Adam's cell, telling him that his wife would want him to release Adam, but that he could not do that. Fisk expressed that they had a shared experience, and spoke about how using a tool had aided him in fights when he was younger.

Fisk opened the cell and threw the axe to Adam for him to use against Fisk in a fight. Adam grabbed the axe and angrily swung at Fisk, who quickly knocked Adam down. Adam got back up and swung again, but Fisk was able to disarm him and proceeded to smash Adam down onto the table. With Adam subdued, Fisk began savagely beating him, punching his face several times. Fisk ended the fight by bashing Adam's head into a brick pillar. Fisk dragged Adam back into his cell and sat at his bed, looking at the wall.[60]

Fisk invited Buck Cashman and Daniel Blake to his office and stated that the city was afraid of Muse, especially as nothing had been done about him. Blake and Cashman informed Fisk that Angela Del Toro was saved from Muse by Daredevil.

Fisk was unsettled learning that Daredevil had resurfaced, and later spoke to Cashman about the vigilante's return. Cashman wondered if Daredevil's return could be good for the city, but Fisk ranted about how Daredevil destroyed his empire, claiming that he was unjustly arrested because of him. Cashman told Fisk that going after Daredevil could be seen as an abuse of power, but he replied that he had a duty to protect the city.

Fisk was visited by Angie Kim, who revealed her suspicion that Bastian Cooper was Muse based off of what she had found out about his history. Fisk asked Kim about Daredevil's return, so she confirmed that he was back. Fisk dismissed Kim, telling her that he would handle the Muse case. Connor Powell called Fisk and reported an encounter he had with Daredevil in Muse's lair, and that Heather Glenn was Muse's next target. Fisk ordered the Anti-Vigilante Task Force to find Muse and save Glenn.

Fisk arrived at Glenn's office, where Cole North informed him that Muse had already been killed before the Task Force arrived, stating that Daredevil had been there. Unwilling to let a vigilante be responsible for defeating a serial killer, Fisk told North to take credit for stopping Muse. Fisk set up a press conference, standing alongside the Task Force, to declare that he had kept his promise to the city.[16]

Wilson was informed from his wife that Luca intended to kill him, so they set up an ambush, with Vanessa giving Luca Wilson's location at a restaurant. While Wilson was having dinner, Luca approached him from behind but was quickly shot in the head by Buck Cashman. Wilson casually thanked Cashman and then asked him to call Vanessa and see if she wanted any food brought home.[16]

Wilson brought Vanessa to Red Hook Pier, where he told her that his project had now received its funding. As they walked, Wilson acknowledged the good Vanessa did for his empire, leading her to wonder why he wanted to throw it away. Wilson clarified that he was simply transforming his empire and that Vanessa's work was responsible for his project coming to fruition. They briefly talked about Luca before Wilson brought up the reason he brought Vanessa to Red Hook Pier.

Wilson entered his dungeon and showed Vanessa to the cage he had been keeping Adam in. Wilson noted that he kept his promise and did not kill Adam, who continued to beg for freedom. Wilson yelled at Adam to stop talking and expressed that he could not live without Vanessa. Gesturing at the key and a gun on the table, Wilson witnessed Vanessa pick up the gun and repeatedly shoot Adam, killing him. Wilson held Vanessa, promising to never leave again, and the two then embraced.[54]

Fisk called a meeting in his office to celebrate the recent victories of his Anti-Vigilante Task Force. Sheila Rivera noted the controversy with their excessive force, but Fisk defended that their methods were effective. Fisk acknowledged Daniel Blake's successful intimidation on BB Urich, and decided to promote him to Deputy Mayor for Communications. Rivera objected, but Fisk dismissed her and revealed that he found out his desk belonged to Fiorello La Guardia.[54]

Wilson hosted an inaugural ball at Gracie Mansion to benefit the Red Hook Port Revitalization Project, with the Anti-Vigilante Task Force stationed as security. In addition to his staff attending, Wilson extended invitations out to BB Urich, Phil Gallo, Heather Glenn, as well as New York's elite that had previously dismissed him, including Artemis Sledge and Jack Duquesne. Now wearing a white suit, Wilson proudly stood before his guests with Vanessa Fisk.

As Wilson greeted his guests, he noticed the arrival of Matt Murdock. Duquesne went up to Wilson, who asked to speak with him privately. In another room, Wilson listened to Duquesne comment on underestimating him back at the fundraiser before bringing up funding for his project. Duquesne went to refuse, but Wilson cut him off, revealing that he knew Duquesne was the vigilante, Swordsman. Wilson threatened to send his Task Force after him, forcing Duquesne to comply with supporting the project.

Wilson spotted a reporter taking a picture of him, so he ordered Connor Powell to deal with him. Wilson met with more of the elite and proceeded to threaten them into supporting his project. Later on, Wilson saw Murdock heading directly for him, but the confrontation was interrupted when a spotlight was cast on Wilson. Vanessa arrived at Wilson's side and told him it was time for their first dance. The couple took to the middle of the room and began dancing, and were soon joined by others, including Murdock and Glenn. As they all danced, Wilson whispered so only Murdock would hear, stating that there would be consequences for his return as Daredevil.

Buck Cashman informed Wilson that Bullseye had escaped from prison. Hearing this news, Vanessa went to confess something to Wilson, but he stopped her, not wanting Murdock to hear. Murdock bumped into them and began dancing with Vanessa, leaving Wilson with Glenn. Wilson spoke with Glenn, mentioning Murdock's history with vigilantes. Suddenly, Murdock dove in front of Wilson and was shot in the shoulder by Bullseye, saving Wilson's life. Wilson dropped Murdock and retreated to safety with Vanessa.[54]

Wilson and Vanessa Fisk were escorted to their room, where Vanessa went to confess, but Wilson stopped her, revealing that he knew she hired Bullseye to kill Foggy Nelson. Wilson explained that they would be able to move billions through Red Hook Pier, with the police and the gangs under his control as the mayor.

Following Bullseye's escape after the attack, Fisk summoned Buck Cashman, Sheila Rivera, Daniel Blake, Phil Gallo, and a few members from the Anti-Vigilante Task Force to his office to order a hunt on Bullseye and all vigilantes. Gallo objected to Fisk's advocation for lethal force. Fisk then ordered for the city to be closed off, but Rivera stated that could only be done if there was a real threat to public safety.

Fisk ended the meeting and told everyone to leave except for Cashman, who informed Fisk that Matt Murdock was in stable condition at Metro-General Hospital. Cashman felt that Murdock saving Fisk complicated matters, but Fisk disagreed and ordered Cashman to kill Murdock. Later, Fisk informed Rivera that the city was at a tipping point and that it needed a push, and ordered her to find anyone in his staff that was not loyal and fire them. Fisk then had the power to the entire city shut off.[49]

Sheila Rivera followed through on her orders and revealed to Kingpin that Phil Gallo was planning on putting an end to him as mayor. Kingpin ordered Luke to intercept Gallo on his way home and bring him to a secure location, where Kingpin had summoned several members of the Anti-Vigilante Task Force.

Once Gallo arrived, Kingpin accused him of letting down everyone in the NYPD, although he stated that it was not his fault for being a cog in a broken machine. Seeing past the deception, Gallo realized that he was right about Kingpin not changing his criminal ways. Kingpin hit Gallo in the throat and knocked him to his knees before squeezing his head with his bare hands. Kingpin claimed that he would protect the city right as he crushed Gallo's head in front of the Task Force members.[49]

Once the blackout ended, Kingpin gathered at New York City Hall to prepare for a televised broadcast. There, he met with Heather Glenn and told her that he would change the city, leading him to offer a job as his administration's Commissioner of Mental Health, which Glenn accepted.

Kingpin then went live with his broadcast to all of the city, explaining that there was an assassination attempt on his life and that the blackout was caused by sabotage. Kingpin claimed that Phil Gallo had resigned, and used it to make a promise that he would not let the city live in fear. Kingpin announced his Safer Streets Initiative, which made all vigilantism illegal, installed a curfew, and put the city under martial law.

With his Safer Streets Initiative being put into effect immediately, Kingpin established his dungeon in Red Hook Pier to become a prison for vigilantes and anyone else who opposed him. Amongst the prisoners kept in cages and guarded by the Anti-Vigilante Task Force were Swordsman and Punisher. Kingpin and Vanessa Fisk walked through the dungeon, passing the cages, and sat down for dinner at a table next to Rabbit in a Snowstorm, where they celebrated their victory.[49]

Despite being one of New York City's most powerful crime lords, Fisk has a very shy and introverted demeanor. He did not like crowds and was uncomfortable around other people, until Vanessa Marianna's involvement. Fisk almost had an compulsive mindset, being a creature of habit and hating when things in his life changed, or went against how they were planned. He preferred to operate out of the spotlight and was loathe to interact personally with his fellow conspirators unless forced to.

However, in spite of his social anxiety and his awkward nature, he is nonetheless capable of being extremely persuasive and charismatic when he needs to be. He has a keen understanding of psychology and social dynamics, which allows him to almost effortlessly manipulate people around him and exploit their psychological and emotional weaknesses. He also has a natural talent for leadership, as his take-charge attitude, the sheer force of personality, and raw physical presence enable him to take control of chaotic situations. As evidenced from the speeches he gave at his press conferences, he knows how to play a crowd as well, feigning emotion and passion in order to rally support from the masses.

He is a polite, articulate, and well-spoken man of courtesy and manners. He expected courtesy from his subordinates as well, as he would attack and sometimes even kill those who did not show respect to him or those he cares about. Fisk is a man of deep sophistication, enjoying the high-class life despite his poor origins. He enjoyed fine suits, fine dining, and classic literature and music. He considered himself a man of honor and always kept his word. While he can be a brutal, cold, calculating machine, he honestly believed what he was doing for Hell's Kitchen was righteous.

However, if Fisk was provoked, he had an unstoppable, almost animal-like rage. His aggression was immense, and nothing could get in his way if those he cared about or his plan for the city were in danger. This was largely due to his abusive father, who taught him to keep hitting someone even when they were bloodied and beaten. Fisk's broken childhood had a lasting effect on him, still causing him nightmares even into his later years. He even hallucinated his reflection in the mirror having the image of his younger self covered in blood after murdering his father. His trauma was so deep that Echo's powers could not completely heal him, but it still served to temporarily strip him of his anger and abandon Tamaha without his former goddaughter.

Fisk constantly kills those who fail him; one of the most famous cases being that of Anatoly Ranskahov, a member of the Russian Mafia, who had his head he smashed in with his car door. He can even go so far as to kill people who betray him to protect his criminal empire, such as his partners Eleanor Bishop and Leland Owlsley or NYPD Commissioner Phil Gallo. He also threatened one of his assistants, Daniel Blake, with the same fate, telling him that if he failed him again, it would be the last thing he would ever do.

There are only five people that Fisk has ever cared for in his life. Fisk's mother was the only person that showed him love and respect growing up, and thus Fisk would kill to protect her, killing both Ben Urich and his own father for her. Vanessa Marianna became the love of his life; Wilson once brutally beat Anatoly Ranskahov to death and removed his head with a car door for simply interrupting their date. When Leland Owlsley had been involved in poisoning Marianna, he threw him down an elevator shaft to his death. James Wesley was the only man Fisk ever called a friend; he was emotionally distraught upon learning the death of Wesley, even kissing the forehead of his dead friend, and ordered the assassination of Karen Page when he found out she was the one who had killed him. Fisk also cared about Maya Lopez and treated her as family, but his relationship with Maya was damaged when she found out that Fisk was involved in her father's murder. Finally, Fisk had a deep respect and almost fear of Madame Gao, and her opinion of him, though this changed after he found out that she was responsible for the attempt on Marianna's life.

Marianna's effect on him made him more vulnerable and less able to run his organization because his focus was primarily on her. He ignored both Gao's and Owlsley's warnings to cut ties to her and as such, Owlsley betrayed him by dealing with Gao and was part of the plot to poison Marianna. Fisk was shocked at his friend's betrayal and it took time for him to come to his senses and kill Owlsley. When his criminal organization was brought down and his plans for the city ruined, he finally snapped and no longer cared about the city, saying it deserved to be destroyed and it deserved people like his father. His belief was shown when he related himself to the antagonist of the Good Samaritan story, as he first thought himself to be the hero of it.

After being imprisoned, Fisk became even more cynical, ruthless, violent, and sociopathic. Having given up on his ambitions to change the city for the better, he became concerned solely with attaining money and power, getting revenge upon the people who had wronged him, and being reunited with Marianna. He also became more impulsive and prone to homicidal outbursts, as he beat Wellers to death in a fit of rage after Benjamin Poindexter failed to kill Page. While he originally showed some reluctance and remorse about killing civilians like Elena Cardenas, this changed after his release from prison, as he displayed a willingness to order the murders of innocent people without a second thought if it would even slightly further his plans. This was evidenced when he had Poindexter go on a killing spree at the New York Bulletin in order to cause a panic, and when he had Julie Barnes murdered to secure Poindexter's loyalty even though it was not necessary.

Despite losing most of his moral compass, Fisk still does have some level of compassion and loyalty in regards to Marianna, who he prized above everything else, even wanting to die at Daredevil's hand when he felt he'd failed to keep his criminal life and corrupt nature from harming her after Poindexter came to assassinate the two of them in revenge for Julia's death. When Felix Manning failed a task, Fisk not only spared him but allowed him to still work for him in gratitude for keeping Marianna safe. He also kept his word not to expose Daredevil or go after Foggy Nelson or Page when Daredevil threatened to expose Marianna to the police as being the one who had ordered the hit on Ray Nadeem. And, despite orchestrating the death of Maya Lopez's father, he loved her as if she was his own daughter.

Fisk became more hegemonic after his second imprisonment, as his obsession with controlling New York City worsened to the point of justifying that the city is rightfully his. He also became more paranoid and aggressive, as he sought to eliminate Eleanor Bishop after she resigned as a partner, which made Fisk conclude that Bishop would rat him out despite not really having any intention, he also fought savagely against her daughter Kate. After his return to New York City and recovering from Echo's powers, he devised a Machiavellian plan to run for mayor.
